intro: Orobus gracilis, commonly known as the slender orobus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they consist of three leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Orobus gracilis is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
